#include <stdio.h>

#include <stdlib.h>

int cmpfunc (const void * a, const void * b) {

   return *(long*)a - *(long*)b;

}

int binary_search(long arr[], int left, int right, long target) {

    while (left <= right) {

        int mid = left + (right - left)/2;

        if (arr[mid] == target)

            return mid;

        else if (arr[mid] < target)

            left = mid +1;

        else 

            right = mid -1;

    }

    return -1;

}

int main() {

    long n, k;

    scanf("%ld %ld", &n, &k);

    long arr[n]; // okay if n is not too big. 

    for (int i=0; i <n; i++) {

        scanf("%ld", &arr[i]);

    }

    qsort(arr, n, sizeof(long), cmpfunc);

    

    long *set = malloc(n * sizeof(long));

    int set_size =0;

    int count =0;

    for (int i=0; i <n; i++) {

        long current = arr[i];

        if (current %k !=0) {

            // case1: add to count unconditionally. 

            count++;

            long val = current;

            // check if val is in set. 

            // binary search the full set array up to set_size-1

            int idx = binary_search(set, 0, set_size-1, val);

            if (idx == -1) { // not present → add to set.

                set[set_size] = val;

                set_size +=1;

            }

        }

        else {

            // mod is zero.

            long temp = current /k;

            // check if temp is not present in set.

            int idx_temp = binary_search(set, 0, set_size-1, temp);

            if (idx_temp == -1) { // temp not present → then count increases and add current. 

                count++;

                // check if current is present in set.

                int idx_current = binary_search(set, 0, set_size-1, current);

                if (idx_current ==-1) {

                    set[set_size] = current;

                    set_size++;

                }

            }

            // else → do nothing.

        }

    }

    printf("%d", count);

    free(set);

    return 0;

}

}
